title: Concept refresher
text: There are three methods for estimating probability: subjective, a priori, and empirical probability. Two of these require calculation, while one does not.

title: H1: Concept orientation
text: Is the probability estimate based primarily on:

hintAnswer: No, no local data were used
title: H2: Data navigation
text: Did the district conduct a pilot study or analyze suspension datasets before producing the estimate?
choices: Yes, extensive local data were analyzed
No, no local data were used
No, but theoretical models were applied

hintAnswer: No, it was not mathematically calculated
title: H3: Computational reasoning
text: Was the 60% estimate calculated using a statistical formula or observed frequency ratio?
choices: No, it was not mathematically calculated
No, it was derived from sampling error estimates

title: H4: Interpretation check
text: If an estimate is based on informed professional belief rather than data or theory, which approach does it represent?
